text:
Hey guys! I'm trying to implement a really basic SGD with a MSE loss, but I'm running into some weird behavior (imo). Any help is appreciated!
```julia> function without_sub_broadcast(η)
           x = Float64[3, -2]
           Arr = []
           for i in 1:5
               x -= (2*η) .* x
               push!(Arr, x)
           end
           return Arr
       end
without_sub_broadcast (generic function with 1 method)

julia> function with_sub_broadcast(η)
           x = Float64[3, -2]
           Arr = []
           for i in 1:5
               x .-= (2*η) .* x
               push!(Arr, x)
           end
           return Arr
       end
with_sub_broadcast (generic function with 1 method)

julia> without_sub_broadcast(0.2)
5-element Array{Any,1}:
 [1.7999999999999998, -1.2]
 [1.0799999999999998, -0.72]
 [0.6479999999999999, -0.432]
 [0.3887999999999999, -0.2592]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]

julia> with_sub_broadcast(0.2)
5-element Array{Any,1}:
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552] ```
Could someone please check if this is to be expected? if so, where do the weird results come from?
I apologize for not making my code more performant, I just wanted to showcase the results.

julia> function without_sub_broadcast(η)
           x = Float64[3, -2]
           Arr = []
           for i in 1:5
               x -= (2*η) .* x
               push!(Arr, x)
           end
           return Arr
       end
without_sub_broadcast (generic function with 1 method)

julia> function with_sub_broadcast(η)
           x = Float64[3, -2]
           Arr = []
           for i in 1:5
               x .-= (2*η) .* x
               push!(Arr, x)
           end
           return Arr

with_sub_broadcast (generic function with 1 method)

julia> without_sub_broadcast(0.2)
5-element Array{Any,1}:
 [1.7999999999999998, -1.2]
 [1.0799999999999998, -0.72]
 [0.6479999999999999, -0.432]
 [0.3887999999999999, -0.2592]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]

julia> with_sub_broadcast(0.2)
5-element Array{Any,1}:
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]
 [0.23327999999999993, -0.15552]

Could someone please check if this is to be expected? if so, where do the weird results come from?
I apologize for not making my code more performant, I just wanted to showcase the results.

text: You are storing the same object x in each location. You need `copy(x) `

elements.text: You are storing the same object x in each location. You need `copy(x) `
